name: Simple Creme Brulee Dessert
author: sous-chef-jason
summary: Rich, creamy creme brulee should still be jiggly in the center when you pull it out of the oven.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Whisk 3 tablespoons sugar and cream in a microwave-safe bowl until well combined; heat the mixture in microwave until warm, 1 to 2 minutes, and whisk again to dissolve sugar
Whisk in egg yolks and vanilla extract until smooth
Set ramekins into a roasting pan and pour in enough hot water to reach halfway up the sides of the ramekins
Bake in the preheated oven until creme desserts are set but still slightly jiggly when shaken, about 50 minutes
Remove ramekins from hot water and chill in refrigerator until cold, at least 2 hours
Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar evenly over the top of each dessert
Use a kitchen torch to lightly toast and melt the sugar topping until brown and bubbly, about 30 seconds
Let the sugar topping cool before serving
To serve, use a spoon to crack the crisp sugar open to reveal the creamy dessert underneath
